Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture, once you remove the Soap Opera Effect
Reviews.Author: John Saylers
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV about 2 weeks ago, based on the good reputation of it's predecessor (the 640U), and after a couple tweaks, I'm very pleased overall with it.HOW TO GET RID OF THE SOAP OPERA EFFECT:Turning off the Motion Enhancement alone will NOT solve it. You also have to go to Picture Settings -> Advanced -> Film Mode, make sure Film Mode is on, and turn down the "Advanced" item. I turned it down from 7 to 0 and viola - The Walking Dead no longer looks like General Hospital. Although it's not labeled on the menu, the manual indicates that this setting is the Judder Reduction.PICTURE: Right out of the box, Sports looked great, but all of our usual shows and movies looked very strange. Upon Googling the "Soap Opera Effect," I found plenty of info on how to correct it, but when turning off the Motion Enhancement didn't do anything, I was pretty worried. I was almost ready to return the TV, but after playing around a little more with the settings, I discovered the above, and now everything looks AMAZING! We have it set on Standard Mode, and with the above adjustments, movies look like you're in the theater and basketball looks like you're IN the arena!SOUND: This is my only complaint. I was prepared for this after reading a lot of reviews - apparently the sound is bad on all of these new giant LED TVs. But it's really bad - sounds tinny, like it's coming out of laptop computer speakers. I just figured it couldn't be THAT bad, but the sound on my 37" Toshiba destroys it. I paired the TV with the Sony HTCT260 Sound Bar Home Theater System which I got on sale for $250, and it sounds phenomenal! True home theater setup - couldn't ask for anything more. I'm not taking off stars for the sound issue since I knew what I was getting into going into it and had planned on buying a sound bar system.INTERNET: Wifi was easy to set up. I skipped it in the initial setup and went back in and did Manual Setup, and I was able to easily find and connect to my wireless network, just like connecting any other device. We don't have Netflix, so I haven't tested that, but I watched about 15 minutes of YouTube videos on there and it didn't freeze or buffer a single time. Pandora also works nicely for party music. I do wish it had Amazon Instant Video as an app, but I'm able to get this through my Blue Ray player anyway.MOUNTING: I mounted it on the wall with a Cheetah Mounts Plasma LCD Flat Screen TV Articulating Full Motion Dual Arm Wall Mount Bracket For 32-65" Displays Up To 165LBS With 10' High Speed HDMI Cable With Ethernet Fits Up To 24" Studs, and it feels solid and looks great. I love the thin frame and the fact that the Sharp logo isn't huge on there. Wish the power cable was a smidge longer - it was *just* long enough to get through the wall, out the bottom, and into the power strip.WARRANTY: I got a 3 year extended warranty directly from Sharp (that starts after the 15 month manufacturer warranty ends) for only $110.

Reviews.Title: (EDITED) Good TV, but inspect upon delivery and look at the bottom of the screen...
Reviews.Author: Michael 3:15
Reviews.Content: First TV that arrived was only carried in by a single delivery guy. When you test this TV, use a WHITE screen and be sure to view the edges. Mine had black flares on the bottom which I noticed while viewing a hockey game. Sharp's customer service was OK, but Amazon's has been great so far. Replacement arrived this AM and it seems better but I still need an hour or so with it to adjust the settings. The repair guy that Sharp sent said that the black flares were caused by "pressure points" in the frame which were probably caused by the television being dragged while in the box during delivery.Update:I have adjusted the settings based on what the other reviewer had posted. For my tastes, that picture is a little too dark. I increased the brightness and sharpness a little bit. However, those settings are a great place to start.For the price, this seems like a good tv. You definitely have to tweak it a bit to get good results though. I still notice some slight light distortion at the very bottom which goes up about an inch and a half. This could be caused by the weight of the television upon the bottom of itself. It is only really noticeable on a plain white screen, and it is much better than the previous one I had. Hopefully this will fade in time once the tv settles in.In regards to support from Sharp, well, it was OK, but they made me send them pictures. Amazon simply said, "OK, we will replace it, no charge for shipping, no problem." You can't beat customer service like that. Everyone I spoke with at Amazon was very kind and professional. Thanks Amazon for putting customer satisfaction first and making the whole process as painless as possible.2nd update:After a few weeks, I am still noticing light flares at the bottom of the screen, they aren't really visible during dark scenes, but it certainly is taking the enjoyment out of watching my hockey games. Contacted Sharp and heard nothing back. Seriously debating returning. It's kind of like buying a new car and noticing a scratch on it you missed when you picked it up. Frustrating. Sharp...where are you? If anyone has a solution to the light flare problem, let me know! To return or deal with it...after a year will this still drive me mad? Will it get worse?3rd update:TV is going back on Friday. Sharp actually was very nice on my last few dealings with them, gotta give them credit for trying. But they said the lighting at the bottom of the screen was "up to specs." It's really a pity because aside from this issue, it is a decent set. LCD does not have the brilliance of plasma though and the bottom of screen during hockey games looked like (and I'm quoting my gal here) "the bottom of the screen is a crumpled piece of paper that got jammed." It didn't do it on the top or the sides, just the bottom. The cause is very likely the weight of the TV upon itself.Well, here's hoping that the new set I ordered is better. But now I'm reading that set has "lag issues" on gaming.I love Amazon, their customer service is top notch, but buying TVs through them is challenging because you can't see the model for yourself in person. You have to rely on reviews and research, which can be a blind buy. Luckily, their return policy is very lenient so you can find the right fit for the dollar and your needs.Goodbye Sharp, hello Panasonic I guess.

Reviews.Title: Solid TV
Reviews.Author: Yuppers
Reviews.Content: After semi-seriously researching new TVs for a month I finally decided to purchase the 60LE650U.  I auditioned it locally along with competing TVs I was considering (Samsung UN60EH6000 and Vizio e601I-A3 to name a couple).  The first things that stood out with the Sharp were the superior contrast ratio and deep black levels.  Picture coloration seemed quite natural...it didn't appear to be skewed towards any color.  Viewing in the store was enough for me to make my decision.I observed the same "soap opera effect" out of the box that other reviewers commented on and followed thier instructions for how to eliminate this.  After a little tweaking, motion seemed natural.  The first thing I tried out was the Netflix app.  After downloading an update, it launched Netflix no problem.  After initial buffering of 5-10 seconds loading a movie everything played smoothly with zero lag whatsoever.  I had previously been streaming Netflix from my computer to my old 720p Sony LCD TV.  In short, I had no idea the kind of resolution I observed on the Sharp was even possible through Netflix...I was blown away by the quality of streaming content (Thor was impressive to say the least).  I haven't made it through all the apps yet, but the ones I have tried and the interface are very nice.In dark viewing with very dark scenes a little edge bleed can be seen originating in the corners of the screen and progressively fading extending about 3 inches out.  This is quite faint however on my unit and is nearly impossible to notice under average viewing conditions.  That is my only minor complaint about the screen.  Otherwise the lighting and picture are very uniform and the overall quality of the set seems quite impressive for the price.So far, zero regret about this purchase & would make again...

Reviews.Title: Phenomenal set, and great value, but not 100% perfect...
Reviews.Author: W. Hunt "SegWayne"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a Samsung 50" Plasma which only lasted about 2 1/3 years (4 months out of extended BB warranty) that had suddenly developed the dreaded "vertical blue lines" down the center.  Originally, I thought to just bite the bullet and buy the 60" Samsung LED that they now had on sale, but noticed that -- for $100 more than what I paid for my new Sharp -- it only had two (2!!!) HDMI inputs and no extended "SmartTV" functionality at all.In the first review I read here for my new Sharp 60le650 TV before buying, it was all about the "Soap Opera Effect" and how to turn that unintential setting off/down...  I'd point people to that review and say it's almost 100% on the money.  Once I turned off that "feature", the picture I get is just outstanding.What I can tell you about the Sharp 60LE650 sitting in my living room is this;- PICTURE QUALITY : Yes, out of the box, you'll want to tinker with the picture and sound quality settings.  You'll also need to turn DOWN the Picture Settings >> Advanced >> Film Mode to ZERO (not off, just down).  Because of the great reviews here, setting up my TV to my likings (and the DVD calibration thing) took about an hour.  Now that it's adjusted, I could not ask for a better picture quality.My one potential issue is the automatic dimming (Energy star settings?) of the screen to accommodate light or dark rooms.  In the older analog days, when a light turned on or off in a room, the TV set would adjust gradually (within a few seconds).  My Sharp (and I'm hoping it's only a setting) seems to be so sensitive that in a dark room, the image goes bright or dark instantly with changes to the scene on the screen itself.  Even a white screen being shown causes the TV to go a little wonky trying to self-adjust the brightness.I tried turning off the energy star auto dimming features, but then the screen got unbelievably bright/washed out and I couldn't figure out how to fix it.  As annoyances go -- as I said -- all TV's do the same, I'm just maybe a little unaccustomed to it on this set, having gone from Plasma to LED overnight.- SOUND : If you're used to massive, theater-level surround sound and 20hz to 20khz bass response, you will be disappointed by the built-in speakers.  There's just now way around that, but I'm honestly surprised by the idea that ANYONE could possibly be surprised by this.  Apples and Oranges.If you're like me (apartment dweller, courteous to my neighbors), the built-in speakers are just fine.  I turned on the automatic volume leveling -- to help with the annoying commercials -- and bass improvement options and *I* believe it'll suit me well.  It's certainly no worse than my former Samsung.  That being said, I've never really done surround sound receivers and such as it really freaks out the pets... :)- SMART TV options : The Sharp 650 series comes with built-in functionality for Netflix, Hulu, and seemingly a "dozen" other features including a web browser.  I tried the Netflix functionality out as soon as I got the picture sorted, and the best I can say is "it works".  I have to confess that I'm a bit spoiled, as I currently use an AppleTV unit almost exclusively for my TV time.  The AppleTV simply does it all better, faster, and more conveniently than the built-in functionality.  The only thing my AppleTV doesn't have is a web browser, but I could honestly never see using the TV's web browser for anything unless I bought a bluetooth mouse and keyboard or I was desperate and didn't have my iPad (or laptop) nearby.In summary, and all in all, Let me say this.For the price I paid (NIB, on sale), this is an incredible TV set for the money.  Unless you're expecting a $5000 TV for around the $1000 mark, you will not be disappointed.  Just know that you'll have to spend a little time getting it "tuned" to your own ideal picture.  Overall, I'm extremely pleased with almost every aspect of the Sharp 60LE650.As for long-term life expectancy of the set, I can only hope it's better than the 2-year-old Samsung plasma it replaces, or that the extended warranty is worth more than the paper it's printed on.

Reviews.Title: Top notch picture, internet trouble
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: If you're simply looking for the best picture, look no further.  The picture on this TV is second-to-none.If you're looking to use all the goodies that come with the TV, such as YouTube, Netflix, and the web browser - be ware!  This TV has issues with network connectivity.I will try to call Sharp tech support.  If they're helpful, I will come back and update this review.Update 6/3/2013After speaking with Sharp technical support, the TV is now connecting to the internet.  The tech asked me to change the encryption algorithm in my router to TKIP for WPA2 (I was previously using AES).  I spoke with two techs, both of them were in the U.S., which was nice.  They also provided me with a direct number should I have to call again.I am updating this review from 2 to 4 stars and will definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: TexasDave
Reviews.Content: First off I want to thank the person who gave instructions on how to remove the "soap opera effect".  LCD TVs never looked right to me and I could never really put my finger on what was wrong but when I heard that term it explained it perfectly. That issue was the main reason I have not upgraded my DLP TV sooner.  I figured it was just something I would have to get used to like projection TVs and bright rooms.I have had the TV for a few days and I am extremely impressed.  I upgraded from my 65" DLP which had gotten to the point where it couldn't be seen with much light in the room.  I never realized how bad it was and how much of the picture I was missing until I saw this TV, the colors and picture are amazing.  One thing that impressed me coming from a projection was it seems to have a true black which I thought only plasmas were capable of.  I don't care much about smart apps but the Netflix one works great over wireless.  For the money you can't beat this TV and I can' think of anything I could get with a more expensive TV that I would enjoy.The only real issue I have with the TV is the remote, it works but its cheap.  Its not back lit and isn't really a true multi-device remote.  The TV relies too much on Aquos Link so if you don't have a Sharp soundbar forget about controlling volume on an external sound device with this remote.  I have a Logitech Harmony remote but sometimes I just want to touch one button to do what I need to do.  For those of you concerned with the sound of the TV, TVs with decent sound went away with tubes and rear projection which were basically gigantic heavy TVs with room for big speakers, get a sound bar or receiver with speakers.  If you buy a big screen HDTV and don't have some kind of real surround sound you are missing out.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: I received this Television last week. I ordered it on Tuesday afternoon and it arrived via Eagle Trucking on Thursday morning. The drivers unboxed the set, attached the stand and placed it on my credenza. They plugged it in, attached the HDMI cable and ran the initial setup. They did all of this in less than 20 minutes. I would rate ordering and delivery as exceptional.Setting up the Wi-Fi connection was a little confusing, but on my third try I succeeded. Most of the problem was me not following directions properly.I was upgrading from a 6 year old Samsung 50" DPL, the difference in the picture quality was tremendous. Right out of the box, without any adjustments, the picture looked good. However after watching for a few hours I noticed some scenes seemed a little washed out and others seemed a little over saturated. There are a total of 41 adjustments you can make to the picture quality. I made a few tweaks, and oh my lord, the picture was terrible, I totally screwed it up. Sharp does offer dedicated AQUOS advisors to assist and help you by phone and through Wi-Fi. Instead I decided to try to find the proper settings on-line. I went to the [...] and found a lively discussion about this TV's immediate predecessor the 640U. (my set the 650U had just been released) Sure enough someone had posted a complete set of tweaks. I applied them and they pretty much worked. The picture was almost beautiful! I made one minor adjustment changing the AV Mode from STANDARD to USER and my wife and I are happy campers. I just came from a friends house where he had just installed a 60" Samsung that cost over a $1,000 more than my Sharp and I believe my picture is as good if not better.As to the SMART features, NetFlix and Hulu Plus are very good. When I first tried to log on to NetFlix a message on the screen told be to upgrade the firmware, I clicked a button or two and within 5 minutes the firmware was up-to-date and NetFlix was working. I can't say much for the included games or for the Browser, and the other Apps are OK. I do wish they had an Amazon App for viewing Prime movies.The remote is OK, nothing special, the keys are a little cramped and it is not back-lit. I use a Harmony One so a lackluster remote is not a big concern.All in all I would make this purchase again. I think at the price this Television is a very good buy.UPDATE: 4/13/13After two full weeks with this TV I am happier than ever. The picture is sharp and very clear. The colors are brilliant but not over saturated. Blacks are very dark with just very minor light bleeding at the corners, nothing to get upset over. The only quibble I have is the "Apps" are just so-so. The browser works but typing with the on-screen keyboard is simply not worth the effort. I have an AppleTV I use for Netflix and Hulu so the Apps are not really a concern, and I never intended to use the TV for surfing the internet.At the price, this TV is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: MOST BANG FOR BUCK!!!
Reviews.Author: ryan bailes
Reviews.Content: I love the tv it is big and beautiful on my wall. The smart apps are nice and quick. Really thin too. I do not regret my purchase although I was skeptical because I am a Samsung and Sony man and have never owned a Sharp. I would buy another Sharp TV

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a good price...for games, blurays and more
Reviews.Author: The Darker side of Light
Reviews.Content: I spent hours and days and looking into TV's. I wanted a 70" without spending more than $2k total! I game every now and then and watch blurays. After extensive research and lots of questions....Here's what  I found out and why I choose this model:For starters, there is NO perfect tv. Just like all other products, it comes down to personal preferences and money. If you are looking for the hands down uncontested winner with no equal, be prepared to spend $8k to $100k  (that's right 100k!) on true perfection. So don't kill yourself and waste your valuable time, instead look for the most "bang for your buck" you can get based on what is important to YOU.Refresh rate... 120mhz is fine and works great for this tv. The Truth is , the human eye can't even see "refresh rate" happening because it's to fast. Also this feature is only as good as other technical features in a tv. You could buy a cheaper tv with a 240mhz rate, but if it doesn't shine in other technical aspects, then it's just a waste and a gimmick to get you to buy it. Also , when it comes to gaming , don't believe for a second that your games will lag, run slow, and be worthless unless on a 240 or 600mhz (plasma) set....they won't!Smart-ness.  Ok if you have a smart bluray player with wifi, netflix, facebook...etc etc, then save yourself some serious money and get a tv that has all the same technical features but is not "smart" . But if you just have to have it, then let me say that all the smart features are great on this tv, the layout, the streaming and wifi all seem to work well, now...is this tv a PC??? no! Will surfing, browsing , chatting...etc be as good as with a pc....no! Are tv's as "fast" as your pc....no!!  Computers are better at computer stuff than tv's are, hands down.  Are they acceptable  on this tv....yes! But no tv is going to give you the same experience as your laptop, desktop or even tablet...not yet anyway but in the future im sure they will all be one in the same.You can put music, pictures ..etc on a usb and this tv does a good job of playback and the "standby slideshow" thingy with your pics on usb is neat!Gaming-- Stunning! I grew up playing games on CRT...black and white ones at that! So when I read about the difference in gaming from LED vs Plasma....I just wanna slap somebody. This tv has game mode, but I have seen no differences or delays between modes. If you have some settings turned way up or maxed , you may experience slight nunances in picture BUT game mode takes care of that and once you get the settings just the way you like them, you will be amazed. the quality is so clean and crisp4,000,000 to 1 contrast ratio - this has a lot to do with clarity, crispness and cleaness of the picture. by contrast compare a top seller like Vizio...cheaper tv , has alot of neat features ...and that magic 240mhz refresh rate...buuuuut  has 1000000 to 1 contrast ratio! 75% less than this tv! So again, what good is that 240mhz if you don't have the technical goods to back it up. This tv looks better than the 60" or 70" Vizio's that I was comparing it to. I went to wal mart and saw a big differencePicture -  Outstanding, blurays look jaw dropping. You can shut off the soap opera effect and the images will still look brilliant. I actually ripped a segment of one of my blurays , put it on usb and nobody could tell that it was being played from a usb stick and NOT a bluray.  it looked that goodI recommend that you get the Disney WOW bluray to calibrate the tv. You can calibrate each mode and then adjust it to however you want afterwardslike with all flat tv's ....you will need a sound bar. the speakers are in the back and it sounds crappy. but they all do.there is minimal glare from the screen and that's a huge plus living in sun drenched south!It's light and energy efficient....DNLA compatible !!tons of connections!I can go on and on... this tv is just plain great. It does everything I want it to. I couldn't care less if it's not 3D, I can't stand 3D anyway so it works for me.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, fair price, unique Wallpaper mode
Reviews.Author: John White "weasel rancher"
Reviews.Content: I got the 60" Costco version of this TV a few months ago. As long as you put it into "Game" mode, you won't have the Soap Opera effect, which is obviously terrible. You can turn off a lot of options to try to get there, but Game mode is the only sure way to escape it. I've played a small set of video games and it looks great. Can't comment on other fast action since I don't do sports.Built-in web browser, Netflix, etc. apps are slow and terrible. I have an AppleTV, with a massively better Netflix interface. Apple TV also let's me AirPlay my Mac screen so I don't have to use Sharp's awful web browser.Remote is fine. Audio out is weird because when you switch it to "fixed" to play from a separate speaker system you still get the volume slider, which will even decrease the volume as you drop below "0" on the 0-100 range. So that's dumb, but benign.I'm really a fan of the gimmicky feature of Wallpaper Mode on this thing. Only models 60" and higher have this. You load images you like onto a flash drive, leave it plugged into the back, and when you turn the TV "off", it instead goes into very low power (they won't say how much) mode and rotates among your chosen images every 3 minutes. After a set period (24 hours max), it goes fully off. The TV doesn't exactly look on since the images have low brightness, and it's really nice to see some art pics I grabbed from Wikipedia rotating on shuffle in lieu of a giant black rectangle. Nice feature that maybe uses the energy of a 20 watt bulb by my guess. When the TV is fully on, I think it uses ~ 120 watts, so the same energy cost of a very bright incandescent bulb. They have a YouTube clip detailing this feature.I guess some TVs are better, but the marginal returns of extra expense seemed irrelevant to me. I looked at sets that were 50-100%+ more expensive, and couldn't see the difference. Nice price, very bright display if you want it to be. Unique Wallpaper mode. Very thin profile. 60" model is only about 67 pounds. Soap Opera effect escapable. Clean plain black appearance with one very subtle brand logo. Even the power-on light can be deactivated. I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Moffet
Reviews.Content: Sharp LED Aquos made in Japan with LCD panels made in the new Sakai factory.  Hard to beat the quality!!!

Reviews.Title: Audio/Video Sync problems
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: This is a nice TV, the picture is fantastic but the audio and video go out of sync on occasion.  I contacted Sharp about this, and they had me change some video settings.  This helped but did not totally eliminate the problem.  I'm hoping that a future software update will resolve this issue.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, good Netflix app, no real app expand-ability
Reviews.Author: Concerned Citizen
Reviews.Content: Good picture, good Netflix app, no real app expand-ability.  Good value. I have the TV in a room with lots of windows and the picture is very clear.  At night, in darkness, picture is also very good.

Reviews.Title: BUYER BEWARE!! TV HAS BEEN BROKEN 6 MONTHS UNDER WARRANTY AND SHARP SAYS THEY DONT HAVE A WAY TO FIX OR REPLACE IT IN PHOENIX AZ
Reviews.Author: Jeff Mitchell
Reviews.Content: BUYER BEWARE!!! The worst customer service of my life. Several thousand dollars for a tv that lasted 3 months. We have called Sharp over and over and gone to the top and they do not have a contractor who will work for them in a city as large as Phoenix and have not offered to replace or ship the tv. We are stuck with a new broken tv and they simply don't care. I don't see them being around long with this level of quality and service. My employer has the same tv and it also only lasted a few months before the screen blacked out. They also could not get Sharp to repair it and ended up throwing it out for an LG.

Reviews.Title: Love This Thing!
Reviews.Author: dyle51
Reviews.Content: This is my first flat panel tv and it is great! I had buyers remorse because it's so huge! Good picture quality.  Only two minor drawbacks; the sound sucks, and the picture doesnt handle darkness very well. Neither of these bothers me though since it's such a huge improvement over what I had before. I've had this tv for several months and still love it. Maybe not a great tv is you're a tv geek, but for the rest of us it's a heck of a good tv. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Absolute Bargain!
Reviews.Author: Street
Reviews.Content: I love this 70" TV.  The picture is razor sharp with 1080p material, and very bright and vibrant.  The design is minimal but not understated.  I download movies and transfer them to my 64GB USB 3.0 flash drive, and this TV plays them flawlessly in all of their 1080p glory.  Since the TV is placed between large book shelves I ran a USB 3.0 extension cable down through the back of my TV stand into one of it's shelves for easy access to plug in the flash drive.  Another great feature of this TV is the matte screen.  I had a glossy screen with my last TV and the thing picked up every refection in the known universe.  This Sharp is night and day though, even in afternoon sun it picks up no reflections.I was able to get this as a used "Like New" deal through the Amazon warehouse deals for only $1400.  In my opinion that was a TOTAL STEAL.  This TV was brand new for all intents and purposes, still had all of the sticker plastic wrapped on it everywhere, none of the packaging was open and such.  Considering that I saw this side by side with a Samsung in the store that cost almost $2000 MORE than this TV and the pictures were pretty much the same, you can't lose with this TV.  Highly recommend..

Reviews.Title: Limited Range
Reviews.Author: Becky Reeves
Reviews.Content: I only have two issues with this TV, which I LOVE otherwise.First, I had to buy a second router to put on the same floor as the TV. It could not pick up my router on another floor.Second, I bought a Sharp model HT-SB60 sound bar home theater system with wireless subwoofer to go with it. The sound is fantastic, but when I set the sound bar in front of the TV, it covers up the remote control sensor on the TV. Bad design! I don't want to mount it on the wall, so I have to put it behind the TV, which doesn't allow me to use the remote on the sound bar. If the TV stood up taller (above the sound bar) or Sharp moved the sensor on the TV to the top of the TV, there would be no problem. When I called Sharp, they acknowledged this is a problem for many people.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Stan_in_TX
Reviews.Content: I have to give this 5 stars due to Amazon's RMA process.  I ordered this and the first TV had weird waves on the screen (hard to explain).  Called Amazon to see what options I had and they sent a new one out.  Got the new set in less than a week later.  The new TV it flawless.  For being so thin, it is really heavy.  The picture is clear and the integrated NetFlix is a big hit at the house (the interface is kind of slow though).If it werent for Amazon, I would rate this TV 2 stars. TV is good for the price.

Reviews.Title: The Right TV
Reviews.Author: Peggy L. Duckworth
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research on LED HDTV's and narrowed it down to two but I really needed a matte screen since my room is flooded by daylight.  The Sharp was the best choice.  Great picture.  This is the second TV I've purchased from Amazon and I couldn't be any happier with their service.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV!
Reviews.Author: Lav Pachauri
Reviews.Content: Was very easy to set up. Wi Fi receiver is not very strong, but is working well once I extended the signal from my modem. Sound quality is just about OK - definitely need an external sound amplifier. Very satisfied with its picture quality and operation.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for great price
Reviews.Author: PGMS "PGMS"
Reviews.Content: Good picture, sharp. Only disappointment is HBO Go is not an available app. Do not bother with 3D or paying 100s more for other brands.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: California Dentist
Reviews.Content: Ok this TV is amazing! it way smarter than other TVs at the same price range! Overall I give this TV a 9/10, everything is perfect aside from one thing. They didn't really provide too much room for you to attach you USB Flash drive, it didn't matter to me since I connected my external hard drive and wont be unplugging it too often.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture and Controls
Reviews.Author: S. Baer "Steve"
Reviews.Content: Update 7/9/13On 6/24/13 a vertical blue line (one column of pixels) appeared near the center of the screen. I called Sharp and got through rapidly. They had me reboot, push several buttons, and read them the data from the screen. Then they had me take pictures. Shortly thereafter, they called to say that they will replace the set, including delivery and installation. I will update once this is done.Update 5/3/13The set is still working perfectly. Pictures from DVD and Bluray are superb!! We are watching Homeland on standard DVD from Netflix. It looks like we are in the studio!  On Bluray, my favorite test is the Rolling Stones IMAX disc. Wow!!On the web side, I am now using a Microsoft K800 wireless keyboard and mouse. It works perfectly. I did add an 18" USB extension cord so that the wireless dongle attached to the set now hangs a bit below the TV and hence has a clearer RF path to the keyboard/mouse. I was able to use the TV's browser to stream the Sanford/Colbert-Bush debate the other night. The off-the-air TV is great also. Picture is superb. The sound exposes the problems at our local TV stations in Savannah. Most insist on transmitting fake "surround sound" instead of pure stereo or mono.I asked Sharp about forcing the set into pure stereo or mono mode per the instructions on page 17 of the manual. They indicated that the TV can only toggle between sound modes actually sent by the station. Since our local stations only send "surround", I am stuck with that. (BTW - The Sharp online question services are great. They provide good answers in a day or so via email.)Overall, I would say that this set is so good that it exposes problems in poor source material.______________I bought the 70LCLE650u about 2 weeks ago, and it is fantastic! I'll write a longer general review when I get more experience with it. I used the Amazon free delivery, and it was here in SC in about 5 days.I don't have HD Sat or cable, but off the air HD from NBC (Savannah)is outstanding. I also tried a Bluray disc of the Rolling Stones on IMAX (via a separate multi-channel sound system)and picture quality is superb.The sound from the built-in speakers is poor (as expected), so I rigged up a homemade sound bar using a Lepai 2020a amplifier (about $25 from Amazon) and a Zuni ($15 from Amazon) smart strip that turns on the amp when the TV comes on, and off when the TV goes off. That drives a pair of ancient AR2ax's for normal TV news watching. A normal sound bar will also do the trick. I especially like that the set remembers separate volume settings in each input mode.Wireless setup was easy, although I had to turn on my wireless beacon or the TV would not detect the SSID. It did not want to accept manual input of the SSID.I tried a Logitech K520 wireless keyboard (from my main PC) on the browser, and it works as expected. A real keyboard such as this is far,far superior to using the Sharp on-screen keyboard. This rig is not a replacement for a PC, but Google searches and movie data look-ups, and news work just fine. I'll now buy a smaller wireless keyboard.My two pearls of wisdom thus-far:1 - Be prepared to use outboard speakers. The sound of the built in speakers on any of these flat-screens, especially with thin bezels is wretched.2 - If you are going to use the browser, buy a real wireless keyboard.So far, so good. This set offers a tremendous picture for a good price.Thanks all for the soap opera info. That is my next step.Steve

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: G. Thoms
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv and I have had it for about 4 days now.  The picture is grainy and the colors are not vibrant as I would of expected.  I have tried tons of different settings, but none of them seem to work.  Maybe I got a bad T.V., but this is going back and I am going to pony out some more Money for another T.V. and hope I have better luck with it.  Amazon has been good about taking the TV back, only draw back is I gotta pay $65 dollars of the return shipping even though I am buying a more expensive TV from them.  Anyways, just my 2 cents of this set

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: bobby
Reviews.Content: I went to purchase the lc-70le640 but when the salesman went in the back he can back and said he had one 640 in stock and one 650 in stock. The 650 model was 70 dollars cheaper. When we compared the features it identical to the 640 except it had the duo-core processor and better smart features plus the bezel around the TV was has as think.  It was a no brain er for me to get the newer model for 70 dollars less. The tv has one of the nicest pictures I ever saw. The smart feature works flawless. Like almost every other new led TV, the sound is not great but I don't care because I'm going through a yamaha receiver anyway. Sometimes I think the picture is actually to clear bc when you watch a block buster movie it's like the actors are in the next room. I had the tv for almost two weeks and it has performed flawless.  if your in need of a good tv for a really good price, give this tv a look.

Reviews.Title: Consider other options before buying this unit...
Reviews.Author: Viqq
Reviews.Content: I purchased this unit in January 2013 (from costco.com); within approx 2 wks of arrival the unit began to display severe lip sync problems (the picture and sound did not line up).  I worked with Sharp customer service for several wks and approx 4 tech service visits (including firmware updates and motherboard replacement).  When this did not solve the problem, Costco agreed to replace the unit with another new one.This second unit has been in place for approx 9 months and developed a dark line horizontally across the screen approx 8 inches from the top (like a line of dead LEDs).  I again went through Costco concierge to troubleshoot.  They put me in contact with Sharp Aquos customer service. Sharp asked me to take photos of the problem and upon receiving them have agreed that the unit is not reparable.The options now given me are replacement with another new one (but none are in stock as the device is no longer being manufactured, or a refurbished unit).  As you can imagine, following the decline of two new sets, bringing a refurbished set is not an attractive option. As it has been >90 days since purchase, Costco declines return to them.So, I'm stuck with a broken TV and the option of replacing with a refurbished one.  I have two other Samsung devices that have been bullet proof since I purchased them years ago.  Lesson learned, stick with Samsung if possible...

Reviews.Title: Great Tv!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on this TV and it lived up to the hype. The Cnet review is pretty dead on with this TV. It has great picture big and bright. Some of the downsides with the TV is it doesn't handle blacks very well and movies aren't the best. I didn't have to calibrate my TV I just turned it to Dynamic. This TV has many different modes you can set it too. This TV works great in my bright living room. That was my main problem with my plasma TV is it had a horrible glare! You can buy other 60 inch TVs that have better picture than this Sharp. For the money this is the best 60in available and highly recommend it.Amazon Customer Service:I had a issue with the first TV delivered. My worst night mare was receiving a damaged TV! I called Amazon and they were very helpful with sending me a new TV with no trouble. My new TV was delivered within a week. They picked up the damaged TV with the delivery of the new one. I just wanted to write about this experience since it was one reasoning was skeptical about buying a TV online. Amazon is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: Audio / Video SYNC issues - Using Direct HDMI from Comcast Cable BOX
Reviews.Author: gradyfly
Reviews.Content: Picture is decent but not amazing...sports looks most clear so if you want it better than thepicture when LIVE Sports is playing, it's not going to happen.Speakers are weak at best -Smart Central is slow but works -LARGEST PROBLEM:  AUDIO / VIDEO sync SLIPS OUT and is REALLY annoying and it happens atleast 1 a month easy.THE FIX:  Go to MENU - picture settings and scroll down to bottom -MASTER RESET Y / N - Hit Y - It still saves your adjustments for whatever reason.It's that or COMCAST CHANNEL UP/ DOWN for about 20 minutes...Not the best, sorry Sharp 70'

Reviews.Title: BEST TV ON THE MARKET. JUST DONT BUY IT FROM
Reviews.Author: glenn frerker
Reviews.Content: After previously buying the 80 inch from local retailer. I looked around to find this 60 for the best price for in our sunroom. after checking around I found them cheaper then amazon, but decided to order from them because I thought they were more trusted. The picture is amazing and clear, and this tv is fairly easy to navigate. setup was no problem as directions get you up and running in no time. I love sharp tvs and will only buy them. However, I will not be trusting amazon for any more purchases. I was guaranteed a delivery of December 6th, after not hearing from delivery company I called them to find out that amazon didn't ship it as promised and it wouldn't even get to the local warehouse until late December 6th. If this is what they do with their guarantee shipping date I will not be buying from them ever again. Great tv. just don't buy it from here

Reviews.Title: For some things, size does matter
Reviews.Author: N.Hugo
Reviews.Content: Once you go with a large TV, it's hard to go back to a smaller unit! This thing is HUGE. With viewing distances under 10 ft., 80 inches may be overkill. DirecTV/cable broadcasts that are heavily compressed do not look that great on the TV due to the artifacts, especially when seen up close. For things like Netflix and Blu-ray, they look great even from around 8 ft.Right now, 4K TVs are not worth the cost of admission, especially when there is so little media available that support 4K at the moment. So instead of spending $12k+ for a large 4K TV, you may as well enjoy this TV for a few years, then upgrade to a 4K unit when there's enough content to support it and the TVs come down in price.As far as the variations between the different Sharp models, I went with the 650 based off of negative CNET reviews of the higher Qurattron models. The color accuracy on the 650 is not perfect, but it's certainly good enough, especially for the price point (and size). With a few tweaks to the colors under settings using a blue filter, I was able to get the colors to a pretty solid place. The other recommendation is to turn off Film mode in Movie settings as it makes the compositions look awful.For games, the unit has around 58ms of input lag. While acceptable for most people for most games, you will notice it if you are very sensitive to it. For games that require frame counting like fighting games, this will have a noticeable effect as you'll be approximately 3-4 frames behind at 60fps. But for most games, it should be within an acceptable/tolerable limit.If 3D is a must have, get the higher models as the 650 does not support 3D.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely LOVE it!!
Reviews.Author: CaptnInsano "Ryan"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic TV! I did many hours of research before deciding on this TV. Trust me, this is your best bang for your buck, The picture looks better than my parents 832u and it looks better than the 7 series.  I have not experianced the white marks people have been experiencing in dark scenes.  I just watched The Hobbit on BluRay and the dark scenes looked spectacular I was blown away by this picture.Pros:Best picture for the price range of $1000-1800, no comparison.CRISP gorgeous pictureSports look GREATFAST UISmart apps are greatSleek lookingCons:Awful speakers, definitely get a soundbar with this.Friends and family will be jealous and may come over to watch TV unexpected.I'm very happy with this purchase and would do it again and again. I will update if I have any problems with this TV, otherwise she is still hummin' along! Shoot me any questions..

Reviews.Title: A great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Jeff C.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this television about two weeks ago, to replace an aging 42" Panasonic plasma. Knowing that I didn't want to break the bank, I looked at both this 70" Sharp and the 70" Vizio. While I haven't seen the Vizio in action (wasn't able to find it at any local stores), I'm quite happy with my choice.Out of the box, the picture settings need a fair amount of tweaking -- something I don't recall ever having to do with the Panasonic, but so it goes -- but I found CNET's recommended settings online and used them to get rid of the soap opera effect and balance out some colors, then I adjusted the brightness and sharpness a bit further to account for my own tastes. When I'm watching something like Sportscenter, the faces of the anchors still seem to have a bit of a pinkish hue, but I'll eventually get around to trying to fix that as well. Even if I can't get it perfect, I'm happy. Everything else looks great, and high-definition nature shows in particular are downright hypnotic.The sound on this TV is not great (but after reading so many negative comments, I expected worse). I had to rely on it for a few days until I realized that my old analog audio cables wouldn't work and I'd need to order a digital audio output cable. Like all large TVs these days, the speakers on the TV are a bit tinny, so I would certainly recommend connecting it to a surround sound system at some point (I use the Panasonic BTT190).I love having 4 HDMI ports (up from two on the old TV), enabling me to connect the cable box, a PS3 and the Blu-Ray player and still have an extra slot. I have not yet used any of the other ports on this TV, but there are several.All in all, I'm quite satisfied. For the price, I'm not sure you could get a better TV. I guess the only thing stopping me from giving it five stars is the amount of work required to get the picture to look right, but perhaps that's just a fact of life with all of these large LED televisions.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Marathon Freak
Reviews.Content: Really a great TV for the money.  I had a four year old 46" Sharp Aquos LCD TV that I replaced with this one simply because I wanted a bigger screen.  I was satisfied with the picture of the old Sharp and this one didn't disappoint me either.  And that's where this TV's strength lies.  I didn't need to make any adjustments out of the box but I haven't run any special calibration software against it either.  It just looks good.  I mounted mine to the wall.  I thought it might look too big up there but it doesn't.  Sharp's wallpaper feature is pretty sweet.  Turn the TV off and it goes into a low power standby mode and displays some canned art making it look more like art in the room that a giant black rectangle on the wall.  Put some of your own pictures on a USB stick (in a folder named "WP"), and it will cycle through those.With 4 HDMI ports, 2 USB ports, and other connectivity (component, composite, etc.), this should meet all your connectivity needs right out of the box.I didn't have any issues with the speakers but I generally run everything through an AV receiver.  When I do use the speakers, they're just adequate.  Nothing special; nothing terrible.I'd definitely recommend this TV.Buying from Amazon is easy but shipping can be dicey.  My delivery was less than seamless and the shipping company (Ceva Logistics) was extremely questionable.  Their 800 number had a message saying their long distance was disconnected and the number you get from Amazon to call them is always either busy or disconnects after multiple rings.  After 7 calls I never actually talked to anyone at Ceva Logistics but 3 calls to Amazon got everything straightened out.  What a pain though.

Reviews.Title: I did my homework and this was the one for me.
Reviews.Author: Oliver
Reviews.Content: Had this for a few months now and I am very happy. Picture is awesome. Internal speakers are rubbish but i paired it up with a Sony sound bar and sub-woofer. A great buy. No remorse. Also a quick shout out to Sharpe for their excellent customer service. They could not be more helpful and their patience with me in setting up this TV was second to none.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HDTV !
Reviews.Author: Larry D. Walker "Ldw"
Reviews.Content: I searched for a long time and did my research.  I was looking for a large screen HD TV that did not have 3-D capability because my significant other has vision problems and did not care about this feature.  I am very pleased with my choice and the picture and other features are excellent.  The only possible quibble is with the audio.  As others have mentioned, the sound volume is a little shallow.  However, this is a complaint common to ALL the new ultra slim HD TV's as they all have sacrificed speaker size for a smaller cabinet.

Reviews.Title: OMG this TV is unbelievable!
Reviews.Author: Wayne Edward Boyd
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest with you. I did not buy this TV from amazon.com. I bought it from Sams Club because it was $100 cheaper and I could get it into my pickup truck then and there. However, this TV is so big that sat out in my garage for 3 weeks until I could get some friends over to help me set it up! It's huge. First and foremost. Big. Big. Big. Picture quality is spectacular. Brightness and pixilization flawless. I'm completely satisfied and I am not always so flattering in my reviews. Some reviews I read were not flattering. I'm not sure why. I have had no issues at all. I did read that the customer service was good but for now I have no need to worry about that. I have the biggest TV on the block and am very happy with my decision. Bright. Even lighting over the entire huge screen. No problem with pixilization on high def TV. It's not 3d but great price and wonderful quality. You can keep reading other reviews if you want but this is the one.

Reviews.Title: Really 'SHARP' TV
Reviews.Author: sarvjeet singh
Reviews.Content: Ok, almost a week after owning the television (60 inch version) and trying to find things that I did not like about the TV, I have to give it five stars. To summarize: (1) Amazing picture (I can only speak for Blurays and Netflix either via PS3 or through TV's inbuilt Smart Central). THANKS A TON to other reviewers like Mr John Saylers without whose tip regarding the 'Soap Opera Effect', I would have spent a lot of time trying to get rid of it. The colors are crisp, picture sharp and simply amazing with the Blurays. (2) I found the sound of the TV to be great; unlike some other reviews that claim poor sound quality. Not only is the loudness decent but the overall quality of the sound from the TV itself is pretty good (I am used to watching TV with my Onkyo home theater and hence can distinguish between quality sound profiles). (3) The TV is slim compared to most other comparable models that I saw and the bezel is reasonably thin. (4) The concept of a dedicated Netflix button on the remote is simply amazing and I personally find it of great use.For the price, I do not think I would have found a better TV.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV - at a Vizio price
Reviews.Author: Meng Qi
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a 70 inch major brand TV around the $1500 price range, this TV is probably your only choice - and probably best value.The TV is heavy but manageable if handled by two people.  I assembled it in 5 minutes with the help of a friend.The menu is a bit unwieldy compared to the smooth, slick menu of LG and Panansonic.  But you get used to it after few minutes, and once you finish configuring the settings you will rarely use the menu again.The TV has zero dead pixel and the BEST screen uniformity of any LCD/LED TV I've seen, even though it is an edge-lit TV.  Screen uniformity is better than my direct-lit LG LN5700.I selected Game picture mode and tweaked the settings.  I recommend using game mode only.  Game mode has very low lag and no soap opera effect.  When watching movies in the dark, simply dial down the brightness.  If you like film effect, choose a warm color temperature.The black level feels like night and day compared to my LG TV which has an IPS panel. IPS panels offer great color saturation and viewing angle, but at a price of light black level.  This TV has inky blacks, but shadow details look slightly crushed.  Also, skin tone sometimes looks slightly unrealistic.Color reproduction is great. Coupled with excellent black level, the picture (especially nature scenes) looks almost real.I ordered a Sharp 757 before.  It is a lot worse than the cheaper 650.  The 757's game mode has a ugly red tint.  The Quad Pixel technology (adding a yellow pixel in addition to the standard red, green, blue) does nothing to improve picture quality.  If you do not need 3D (which I assume most people don't), then just pick up the 650.  The 7 and 8 series would be a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Audio delay....
Reviews.Author: l.larra
Reviews.Content: We bought this back in june when it was on sale.  It was delivered within a few days and the delivery person unwrapped it and turned it on to show us everything's in fine condition before he left. everything seemed to work fine. We couldn't hook it up right away as we were renovating, so it wasn't until over a month later when we finally installed it onto the wall and started actually watching Tv with it.  Well, the screen and visuals were really great - no complaints.  The sound was too low but we knew that going in and we got a soundbar so that's fine.  However, the problem is when watching cable tv there is an audio delay that happens every....30 minutes? an hour?  changing channels or using the freeze button will get rid of it, only to have it happen again....shortly.  If we weren't past the 30 day return period we definitely would have tried to return it.  Well that was 5 months ago and its still happening. We're way past the return period now so i guess we're stuck with it.  you can say that its the cable box's fault not the tv, but why does my other TV (a samsung 55") work perfectly fine?  bottom line is something is wrong with this tv. It's otherwise perfect but this problem really drags it down. a lot.

Reviews.Title: Sharp 70" LC-70LE650
Reviews.Author: J. Burke
Reviews.Content: This review is for the 70 inch. But first off I give Amazon 5 stars for this whole transaction. I bought this TV to replace my 3 year old Panasonic 63" Plasma. I loved that TV, but it was big, bulky and heated up the room. I had the chance to sell it to a friend for a great price and got caught up in the "bigger is better" mindset as I was also awaiting my PS4 to arrive, so I thought, "let's go all out and get a 70 incher". I should state that I am pretty picky and notice small details. A crooked picture on the wall will drive me nuts, if something is off center I need to correct it. I'm not OCD, but close. Ha.Delivery was flawless and the TV was in perfect external shape. The pros are the TV is very slim and light and was extremely easy to mount on the wall. Setup was easy and it took only minutes to get it up and running, Then that is when the disappointment began.I noticed flashlighting in all 4 corners. In particular, in the lower right corner, the flashlight effect covered about 10" of screen. This was really only noticeable on a totally dark screen. I also had the Disney WOW DVD so I got into correcting the colors, etc. I read many reviews on the Soap Opera Effect and it is very strong on the TV. I followed all the advice, and the only way I could 100% get rid of it was to put it into Game. The whites were bright, but the darks were poor even when properly calibrated with the WOW disk. I watched this TV for two weeks and I constantly tweaked setting and I was never fully pleased. One show on one channel would look good, then the colors would look wonky on another. I felt like there was always something on the screen that would distract me. Either the flashlight effect cutting into a dark scene, juddering on another, and the list went on. I'm a tech savvy guy and I know the way to solve 99% of problems! With this I never had any luck. Did I get a TV that had more flashlighting than what others have had, maybe. Am I just more picky than some, probably. But there was no way I could keep this TV with all these obvious flaws visible to me. This experience also made me realize I'm still a Plasma guy and not an LCD.I contacted Amazon and the return process was painless. The representative was fantastic, and a few days later, the carrier came to pick up the TV. I didn't even want to try a replacement and go round and round again.In its place I got a new Panasonic 65" Plasma (P65S60). Now THIS is an excellent TV and the picture is simply amazing. Also considering I got it for several hundred dollars less than the Sharp, this was a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Price, and Buying Experience
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this TV on Amazon, and I am very please with the whole experience. The price is great, reliable shipping that was free, and the TV works very well. The most surprising part of the experience was how impressed I was with the shipping. I was worried to buy such an expensive item online due to the hazards of shipping, but Amazon did it right. Not only was the shipping free, but I was able to schedule when it was delivered. Then, it was delivered in the timeframe of the schedule I requested! What a grand concept...a company actually sticking to a schedule. The delivery guys even called me when they were 15 minutes out and brought the 80 lb box right into my home.Now on to the TV...- For the price, you will not find a better TV.- I had to fiddle with the picture settings to get it just right for my room, but that took 5 minutes.- It has a plethora of HDMI ports- The smart TV aspect is great. It really works better than I expected. My iPhone connects to it super easily, and I can do some pretty cool things incorporating uTube/iPhone/apps.Overall, I highly Recommend.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: A. R. St Jean "ARS"
Reviews.Content: Everything about this tv is excellent except that the wifi connection is too weak to work. Contacted the Aqous people and they informed me that if the tv is not in the same room as the modem it may not work at all. (the tv is in an adjacent room about 20 feet away). All my other devices (Kindle, Wii, laptop)work fine even outside. I have a very fast broadband connection with a top of the line modem but it doesn't seem to matter.

Reviews.Title: Huge tv, average picture quality and motion processing
Reviews.Author: Matt Blevins
Reviews.Content: I cannot give a really thorough review on this tv because the one I received from Amazon was sent back due to serious a light bleeding issue along the right side of the screen. A few things I noticed right away, motion looks very choppy when watching sports. (the set was calibrated using cnet's settings at first, then sharp tech support made adjustments to try and eliminate the motion blur and light bleeding) I also felt that the picture quality was just average. The picture on my 4 year old LG LCD looks much better IMO. I was extremely disappointed with this set as a whole thankfully Amazon was great allowing me to return the unit with no hassle.I exchanged this unit for the LG 55la6200 and could not be happier thus far. The 5" difference is slightly noticable but its superior picture quality makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Eugene E Noyes
Reviews.Content: Arrived 6 days ago via Pilot shipping.  The shippers did a great job, packaging show no damage and TV was in perfect condition out of the box.  The driver unboxed and tested the TV and the remote while I watched.  After I installed the small stand and placed the unit on the TV table and hooked up the set top box; we turned  it on a everything looked quite good.  I used the setting from the CNET review, made 1 small adjustment to the hue.... and WOW - it has and outstanding picture.OTHER:  Amazon lowered the price $65 after the TV shipped and when I called for a price match I request was handled prompted and I left the call a happy guy.If anything changes in the next 30 days or so I'll amend this review, ut right now I could not be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: Smart functions really bad
Reviews.Author: Ernest Scinto
Reviews.Content: As a TV it's fine. Picture is good. Sound is good. But the Smart functions are just terrible. Takes minutes to switch between a video signal and Netflix. Sometimes it doesn't work and you need to turn it off before you can get into Netflix. Buy a different one if that's what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Excellent Price
Reviews.Author: Mandy Payne "Is it just me?"
Reviews.Content: We have had this for about five months.  We love it and I came to cast my vote for this being an excellent purchase.  The picture is beautiful and crystal clear.  The setting and display are intuitive, even for me, a middle aged woman with no technical skills whatsoever.The price today is a couple hundred lower than we paid, so that is good for the next buyers.  We expect prices to drop so no surprise or disappointment for us.  We would definitely purchase this television again.  We've had a few Aquos TVs by Sharp and have always loved them.

Reviews.Title: Sharp 60" LED tv - questionable
Reviews.Author: Paul H. Bowen "PaulB"
Reviews.Content: Poor image quality - lower contrast and blacks than my Sony.  This set arrived with an objectionable artefact (horizonatl lines in upper 25% of image).  Sharp is dragging their feet about servicing / replacing the set.  Apparently do not have any service in North Georgia ... anywhere.  They want photos of the set, the image, the serial number... I've sent them in twice, spent long wait times on the phone, long times troubleshooting with service representatives (some rude, most very agreeable)  Promise service calls didn't happen.  Delayed return phone calls, or none.I've had it with Sharp.  OK. so buy the TV, but don't count on Sharp service.After a month of telephone tag, ONE phone call to Amazon arranged replacement - no hassles.

Reviews.Title: Great big TV
Reviews.Author: bluraven
Reviews.Content: Picture quality way surpassed my expectations with the color and clarity from a blu-ray that it can display so beautifully but I do notice one oval shaped shadow in the backlighting in the center of the screen but it's only noticeable in bright daylight panning scenes and most of the time I do not see it but it can be annoying when I do see it but you really have to be looking for it to see it.  Coming from a 55 to a 70 inch I was floored by the size.  The motion enhancement I actually really like and it makes everything look and move like real life to me, which I much prefer to looking at judder in a panning scene (which the motion enhancement also eliminates).  I like all the features it has but will never use them as I prefer external devices rather than built in apps any way.  Love that it has a quick on feature too, you turn it on and picture is displayed in less than two seconds with the logo disabled in the options.  Overall I am impressed by the quality for the price and am very happy I chose this one.

Reviews.Title: The Best Deal of 2013 Holiday Seasaon
Reviews.Author: David Huang
Reviews.Content: I was very Happy to make the adjustments in the settings to turn down the clearness of the picture so I don't have the "soap opera" look.  This was by far my best television purchase.  I love the internet smart search features that comes with this set, although I am struggling to utilize the web broswer I am sure I will get a custom to it.  Like earlier reviews the set has a lower than expected remote to pair up with this fantastic TV.  To those who are looking to buy this TV I suggest you buy the 80" because once you sit in front of this set you will realize that it is not that big and wished you could have gone bigger.  Great TV no problems so far thanks to the tips from prior buyers who gave great advice.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as my Sony
Reviews.Author: Jim Palmer
Reviews.Content: Not as good as our 52" Sony that is 4 years old.  And, it is not as good as our 42 inch Sharp that is 6 years old.  Picture is somewhat jerky, movement is just not perfect.  Seems to have difficulty with focus, however that may be in the camera and not in the TV.  But, when it is good, it is very good.  Added the Sony Sound Bar for a theater like listening experience.  I failed to get the TV at the lower price when I ordered; for the difference, I wish I had gotten the Sony with the DirecTV connect feature.

Reviews.Title: fabulous tv
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: the sharp aquos led tv is the best sound and picture quality I could hope for.  Easy set up and operation.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: T. DeWitt
Reviews.Content: With so many good reviews already written about this TV, I'll keep mine as short as possible.I love the quality of the picture once it's properly adjusted. We found using the settings offered by CNET poster "tpendlebury" (Google "Sharp LC-60LE650 picture settings") worked the best for us, with the exception that we used Amazon reviewer John Saylers' advice and turned film mode on and then turned the advanced setting down to 0. After going through the picture adjustment process, everyone who's seen our new TV agrees that the picture is absolutely awesome.Sound on this TV is pretty bad, but I'm not gigging the rating for it because it's a problem with almost all slim design HD TVs. I bought Sony's HTCT260H Sound Bar with Wireless Subwoofer to go with the TV and the sound is absolutely amazing.One thing I really don't like is the remote. It's "line of sight" so anything placed in front of the TV will interfere with the remote's operation. Additionally, the remote has no QWERTY keyboard. I'm not gigging the star rating for this shortcoming because most similar TV's in this price range come with the same low tech remote.All things considered, we're very, very happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great value if you don't mind the picture motion
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: TV is an excellent value if the "soap opera effect" does not bother you. My husband did not notice but I was extremely bothered by the picture motion.  I tried another reviewers advice with the settings but it I still noticed it and called customer service.  The representative I spoke to stayed on the phone for around 30 mins talking through different fixes for the problem but when I was still dissatisfied they said they would send out one of their technicians to my house and have them set up the picture to where I like it free of charge (and they came in 2 business days).  Unfortunately I decided I cannot get used to the "General Hospital" images and am returning the TV.  After further research this is a common issue among LED tv's so I going to go back to a plasma.  I bumped up the score to 4 stars because of the excellent customer service given by Sharp, also Amazon was wonderful setting up the return.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: John G.
Reviews.Content: We love our TV.  We have had it now for a year.  It has a great picture and have had no problems with it.

Reviews.Title: Pleased!
Reviews.Author: CAT
Reviews.Content: Not a tech geek so in laymen terms, great picture quality after removing the soap opera effect. Did not tweak with any other settings; only turned motion enhancement off and film mode to zero as advised by previous reviewers. Weak sound but I don't mind raising the volume to 50 or perhaps investing in a surround sound system later on. Speedy power on and off. Smart Central with wifi, apps and split screen capability (for tv and internet browsing at the same time) are a plus. Keep in mind, a 70 inch will visually spoil you and your family. You'll have a hard time re-adjusting to smaller tvs elsewhere. Video games are graphically stunning. I don't think my boyfriend will ever enjoy playing on any smaller screen. If you're planning on getting the 70 inch, just get the 80- what I wish I did. No regrets whatsoever though. A beautiful, consistent tv thus far and Amazon has probably the most competitive price. Paired it with Mount-It!'s Full Motion Swing Out Tilt and Swivel Articulating Dual Arm from Amazon as well. Installed professionally however (using Anthony's Professional Tv Mounting Service based out of NYC, Yelp-able). Shipping was quick and as scheduled. Arrived undamaged thankfully. Overall, very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous detail on big screen
Reviews.Author: Mark K. Goldstein
Reviews.Content: We replaced an LG 47" and got this 60" Sharp about 4 months ago.  Now sitting 11ft away is ok , We dont have to use our old Panny projector, After turning off motion enhancement and adjusting the brighness down a bit,  this Sharp is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: Amazing, Amazing, Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Richard P. Skagerberg "Trooper TK-692"
Reviews.Content: It gets the job done. It has a slight lean forward but that's easily fixed by propping something underneath it. While top heavy, whoever thought putting more of the base (behind) the tv was smart. Should be fired. I'd feel safer using the base if the front had more protection since it does lean that way more.Definitely worth the money, for how cheap it is.If I could mention anything, don't use for gaming if you don't use a Headset OR surround sound. Sound on this is not what you'd expect, too loud and you will discover sharp static.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: lynn
Reviews.Content: this tv is so amazing!!!! We switched from a 42" tv, to this 70" tv. What a difference. Now, we want one of these for the bedroom, because it makes all out other tvs look pitiful< I recommend this tv 100%

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: Richard H.
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for four months.  Clear picture and reliable product. Sound is weak as expected. Really love it.

Reviews.Title: Sharp Aquos TV
Reviews.Author: jt
Reviews.Content: just as advertised. works perfectly . The picture is out of thsi world once you fine tune it. So many bells and whistles for the price. Like having a huge PC montor and I couldnt be more pleased. Shipped and arrived quickly

Reviews.Title: Looks great!
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Hamilton
Reviews.Content: Just received it a couple of weeks ago.  Looks great.  One thought for improvedment -- allow swivel to base for more flexibility.

Reviews.Title: good price
Reviews.Author: R. Collins
Reviews.Content: have been contemplating buying a sharp tv for a while;  works great and really good sharp picture; have some trouble getting on internet, but not TV's fault

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Rod
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for the price. Very slim and fairly easy to use. I recommend this TV highly.

Reviews.Title: We love our new TV!
Reviews.Author: D. Coleman
Reviews.Content: We recently upgraded to this TV from a 42 inch old school plasma. It was a big decision for our family and we don't regret it one bit. The picture quality is amazing and it looks good on a credenza or hung on the wall. I took the advice of removing the soap opera effect (thank you to the previous reviewers) and it looks great, however by leaving that alone sports still look incredible. After researching several TVs it was between this and the Vizio. I know the Vizio is a great TV as well but we went with the Sharp Aquos based on reviews of reliability and access to customer service, if we ever need it. The smart TV features are neat - feels like home with the rest of our household technology (phones, tablets, etc.) I'm not a "techy" but can definitely say this is a good TV if you are on the fence about it.

Reviews.Title: Solid Value
Reviews.Author: Dalip Singh
Reviews.Content: Color accuracy appears a little saturated but consider it excellent for the price.  Would recommend to anyone looking for a reasonably valued, large SMART TV

Reviews.Title: Not Quite
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: So I bought this 80" TV and decided to send it back within 24 hours...probably less than 4 view time. Just wasn't a good picture, in fact it was terrible, I found Blurays to look awful and Netflix was unbearably blocky. Some people might like it, but I'm too picky about my picture.I went with the Samsung 75" 6400 instead and I think the difference is night and day, despite giving up 5" on the diagonal.

Reviews.Title: Major Flashlight Effect - Already on 2nd Replacement; otherwise Great TV.
Reviews.Author: B. Jacobs
Reviews.Content: I want to love this TV.  60" is the perfect size for my family room and looks great on my wallmount; very sleek looking.  Sound quality is fantastic for TV speakers.  The features of this TV are great including the Smart TV features.  Youtube app works great and the processing power of the smart apps is fast and sastisfying.  The menus are quick and detailed and the menu response times are very fast.However, I returned the first one because of light bleed (flashlight effect) and the second TV that I received has this flashlight effect worse than the first one.  My second TV has it all over the top, sides, and bottom edges and also there are uneven cloudy spots on the middle of the screen.Because I really want to like this TV, I'm giving Sharp and Amazon one more chance and just ordered my second replacement TV.  I will update my review once the TV arrives and I've had a chance to review the TV.Amazon's customer service is hands-down the best.  The process of returning a large 60" TV is easier than if I was returning a product to a "big-box" store.  The shipping companies (two different ones so far) are courteous and will even repackage the returning TV for you.  Also, Amazon customer representatives are knowledgeable and stand behind their products.  They want their customers to be happy.  Because of this, I recommend others that are deciding between purchasing products on Amazon or local stores to strongly consider Amazon.More to follow.30 October 2013 Update: I received my second replacement TV and this one has a small flashlight effect which is barely noticeable and a small part of the middle screen that is a little cloudy when the entire screen is black (when in an input mode that is not connected to anything).  I decided to keep the TV.  So far, I'm happy and sports, movies, TV shows all appear very good picture quality.  Thanks Amazon for finally getting me a non-defective Sharp TV!

Reviews.Title: Great TV with room to improve.
Reviews.Author: trevorj
Reviews.Content: First I just want to say how great Amazon has been through this tv purchase. I was a little hesitant purchasing such a large item from anyone other then a local brick and mortar just in case there was something wrong. Well the first tv purchased arrived with a crack on the bottom plastic by the speaker. They sent out a replacement which arrived a week later. Unfortunately i noticed a narrow block of what appeared to be dead pixels along the side of the screen that was about an inch long. The second tv was replaced and received this one which is great. Through the process the price had dropped and they credited me that as well.As far as the actual tv I've owned it for several months now. For the most part I love this tv although there are a few hiccups. I think the picture quality is pretty good for such a large screen at this price point. You just have to be aware of what the actual source material is. The tv isn't a magician it's not going to make standard definition look spectacular. I do occasionally see a glimpse of the soap opera effect but it's not horrible over all. The screen is matte which does a great job of not reflecting the light in our living room. Our previous tv was a Samsung 55" LCD which had a glass front panel and was horrible in the middle of the day to watch. The smart tv features are pretty basic but I wasn't really looking for that because we have a Apple TV and PS3. I actually was looking at the model below 550 but this was the same price and it had wi-fi to do any of the firmware upgrades. The one thing it's missing is Amazon Prime video which would make it great. I can't say much on the audio as I've only heard it through the tv speakers  few times but I'd suggest a surround system because it's a night a day difference. Overall glad I made this purchase and great experience.

Reviews.Title: Great Value, Great Features
Reviews.Author: Bryan Geruntho
Reviews.Content: Have had it for 3 weeks so far...very satisfied.  Tons of features.  I'm using 20MPS cable modem, all smart features work great.  Blu-Rays look fantastic...follow others' instructions on getting rid of the SOE.  No idea about audio as I have it hooked to a full 7.2 sound set-up.  Built in browser is a little awkward to use, but that's not why I got the TV...I have enough devices for that.  If you're on the fence, I say go for it.

Reviews.Title: I am not an expert but I think it is great
Reviews.Author: Kira
Reviews.Content: I have had the TV for a month or so now. It looks great to me. I don't like the normal mode which is much too bright for my tastes. Once it was changed to game mode though the flesh on people's faces looked much more normal.The TV weighs nothing at all and is easy to move around. The sound is awful, but I don't count that against the TV since it doesn't seem like any manufacturer puts decent sound in these LCD panels anymore.The apps that come with the TV are nice. I tried netflix for the first time because there is a netflix app on the TV. The web browser is kind of useless because using the remote as a keyboard will drive you crazy. Hooking it up to the internet was trivial.The TV seems like it has been there forever and is part of the house, so I guess that means that I like it so much I don't even think about it anymore!

Reviews.Title: Was Great For 3 months  & heres Why..
Reviews.Author: Lavender
Reviews.Content: I was thinking  Hmmm  Sharp is  The Best,And It was for 3 Months,,,,I only Moved it ONCE…. Very Very Carefully….I guess  Sharp  is Sensitive ?Anyways  One day I was Planning to watch a Dvd I just Bought.I turned on The Tv,  colored Lines  ( Real Pretty ones  Haaaa)  gotta joke or Ill Cry,Anyways,I have 4 Year warranty  on it,Called  it  & they Said to e mail them a Picture  of  it  WHICH I DID,took 5 Days to get a AnswermCalled them Back  & they said It was DAMAGED  HMMMM WHAT?thats Funny.  Only Moved It 2 Feet…I have No  Kids,I watched It  Every Night,it was Off In day time,,,So Now  They said I have to pay 8 Hundred Bucks  & they will bring me a Used 60 Inch  Tv.what a Joke and a Half….Please Be aware Of What Is What,,,Im Not saying its not a Good Tv, Its who I was Dealing with,,,,,Live N learn I guess,No More Sharp for Me……Ill Live with the Used One they Bring…Then a Sony Or any Kind…If goes Out Again……….I have  No Company  either,So I dunno  Live N learn  …Please Be Carefull ….

Reviews.Title: Great 70" TV
Reviews.Author: luetk01
Reviews.Content: Picture is amazing (once you turn off the automotion feature) and movies/sports look great on the tv. Sound wasn't great but didn't matter to me because I hooked it up to a soundbar. My only compliant is that the wifi feature doesn't work the best. I think the wifi from my other devices (PS3 and bluray) interfere with it, which the manual does say is possible. I haven't tried disabling those, but I don't really plan on using the internet features much.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price!
Reviews.Author: WORKOUT JUNKY
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Sharp I have in my house.  They all have great picture quality.  I see there are some reviews on here that claim the picture quality is poor.  I seriously have no idea what they are talking about, another thing to keep in mind is that some cable providers make you purchase HI Def channels, (DISH is one of them) if this is the case then the TV wont display in Hi Def.  Another thing to keep in mind, I have DISH and only the TV the is directly connected to the box will get the Hi Def, the other TV will not since the box controls 2 TVs.
